item.description:
Note: This is a repeat of the workshop being offered on Saturday, due to popular demand for this topic!

A local version of the popular MOFGA grafting workshops....

Learn to propagate and reproduce your favorite fruit tree varieties. Instructors Jennifer Ries and Bennett Verbeck of Whiffletree Nursery will explain why to graft and demonstrate the techniques for Whip & Tongue and T-Budding (indoors) of new trees as well as Top-working (outdoors) of established trees. This class is hands-on and participants will graft stock to take home and plant. Care for seedlings will be discussed. Also, time permitting, we will look at spring orchard care and basic pruning techniqes. Please bring a sharp knife, a bag lunch, and clothing appropriate for potentially wet or cold weather. Course will run from 10-4 pm.

We do have space "under cover" with optional heating if the weather is very cold. Coffee/tea/water will be provided throughout the day!

$45 per person if you register and pay before March 21. $50 after that!

Fee includes all supplies including rootstocks, grafting tape, treekote, labels, sharpies, rags, etc. Grafting knives will be available for sale if you do not have one of your own. Handouts provided.

Jennifer and Bennett live on a small farm in Brooks, Maine. They make a living at their Whiffletree Nursery for which they graft trees and propagate fruiting shrubs and ornamentals. They grow their own food and meat and use a draft horse for farm work. Bennett began grafting over 20 years ago and made his living exclusively from nursery work and homesteading for many years. Jen began grafting about six years ago. Besides homesteading and growing trees, Jen works for Fedco Trees and guides wilderness trips. Bennett works on boats and is preparing to sail around the world.
